verses.kjv: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.
verses.ct: Without a doubt, God is good to Israel — to those whose hearts are pure.

verses.kjv: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.
verses.ct: But I nearly lost my footing; I almost slipped and fell.

verses.kjv: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
verses.ct: Because I was jealous of arrogant people when I noticed how well the wicked were doing.

verses.kjv: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.
verses.ct: They don't struggle even in death; their bodies are healthy and strong.

verses.kjv: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.
verses.ct: They don't suffer the hardships that everyone else faces; they aren't afflicted like ordinary people.

verses.kjv: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.
verses.ct: So pride wraps around them like a necklace, and violence covers them like clothing.

verses.kjv: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.
verses.ct: Their eyes bulge from abundance; they have more than they could ever imagine.

verses.kjv: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.
verses.ct: They mock and speak with malice; from their arrogance they threaten oppression.

verses.kjv: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
verses.ct: They speak as if they could challenge the heavens, and their words spread across the earth.

verses.kjv: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
verses.ct: So God's own people turn to them and drink in everything they say.

verses.kjv: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?
verses.ct: They ask, 'How would God know? Does the Most High even pay attention?'

verses.kjv: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.
verses.ct: Look at these ungodly people — they cruise through life without a care and keep getting richer.

verses.kjv: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.
verses.ct: Truly, I kept my heart pure for nothing and maintained my innocence for no reason.

verses.kjv: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.
verses.ct: I've been afflicted all day long and disciplined every single morning.

verses.kjv: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.
verses.ct: If I had said these things out loud, I would have betrayed the community of your children.

verses.kjv: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;
verses.ct: When I tried to make sense of all this, it was agonizing to me —

verses.kjv: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.
verses.ct: until I entered God's sanctuary. Then I understood what would happen to them in the end.

verses.kjv: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.
verses.ct: You certainly placed them on slippery ground; you threw them down to ruin.

verses.kjv: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.
verses.ct: How suddenly they are destroyed! In an instant they are completely swept away by terror.

verses.kjv: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.
verses.ct: Like a dream that fades when someone wakes up — Lord, when you rise up, you will dismiss them as nothing.

verses.kjv: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.
verses.ct: When my heart was bitter and I felt torn apart inside,

verses.kjv: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.
verses.ct: I was so foolish and ignorant — I was acting like a senseless animal in your presence.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.
verses.ct: Yet I am always with you; you hold me by my right hand.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
verses.ct: You will guide me with your wisdom, and afterward you will welcome me into glory.

verses.kjv: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.
verses.ct: Who else do I have in heaven but you? And there is nothing on earth I want more than you.

verses.kjv: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
verses.ct: My body and my heart may fail, but God is the rock of my heart and everything I need forever.

verses.kjv: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.
verses.ct: Those who distance themselves from you will certainly die; you destroy everyone who is unfaithful to you.

verses.kjv: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.
verses.ct: But as for me, being close to God is what's best. I have placed my trust in the Lord GOD so that I can tell everyone about all that you have done.
